sentences.sContent: Scientists now know that this common ancestor, 'the first eukaryote', was a lot more sophisticated than any known bacterium.
sentences.sContent_eng: Scientists now know that this common ancestor, 'the first eukaryote', was a lot more sophisticated than any known bacterium.
sentences.sCn: 科学家现在知道，这个共同的祖先，“第一真核生物”比任何已知的细菌都要复杂得多。

sentences.sContent: Grypania may have been either a bacterial colony or a eukaryote — an organism with specialized cells, enclosed in a membrane.
sentences.sContent_eng: Grypania may have been either a bacterial colony or a eukaryote — an organism with specialized cells, enclosed in a membrane.
sentences.sCn: 卷曲藻可能是一个菌落，或者一种真核生物——其包裹在细胞膜内的细胞功能已经出现分化的生物体。

trans.tranOther: any member of the Eukarya, a domain of organisms having cells each with a distinct nucleus within which the genetic material is contained
